results.title: To meet a challenge
results.brief_description: Aluminium is one of the most sought after metals in use today. All the stages in the manufacture of aluminium, from the mining of bauxite, the raw material, to the pressing of the metal into its final shape is depicted. As well as its mines in the Darling Ranges, Alcoa also owns refineries at places such as Kwinana and has ready access to ports to speed the finished product on its way, whether it be destined for Japan or the United States.

results.title: To live in darkness
results.brief_description: Shows the hazards facing workmen who, through carelessness or deliberate neglect, fail to wear goggles when these are necessary for safety. Deals with factory conditions.

results.title: To learn day by day
results.creator_credit: Alex Jaye and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Offers advice to child care providers on appropriate strategies to facilitate the learning of basic concepts such as big, round, etc. as well as number games and colours. Provides a strategy which involves starting with concepts and moving on to comparisons. Appropriate for professional Development and personal development (Home Economics) at VCE level.

results.title: To clone or leave alone
results.brief_description: The cloning of Dolly the sheep focused world attention on the future of human cloning. Suddenly the possibility seemed much closer. But, as we see in this program, cloning has been going on for years. In 1966 Dr. Joshua Lederberg first cloned tadpoles and since then cloning in the plant and animal kingdom has proceeded at a rapid pace. This program looks at the advantages and disadvantages of cloning and the moral and ethical issues surrounding the scientific possibilities. Includes teachers notes.

results.title: To climb a mountain
results.creator_credit: Ted Abenheim, Dennis Passaggio and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows how blindness is a handicap that can be overcome. Presents a story about a young man and woman and a group of their friends who successfully climb a mountain. Explores their feelings about their accomplishments as blind people and examines the attitudes of society about blindness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Abenheim, Dennis Passaggio and BFA Educational Media

results.title: To Chapultepec = A Chapultepec
results.brief_description: This film provides some cultural background to Mexico, especially Chapultepec to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “Entender Y Hablar”. This is a spanish language film that includes new words which describe what four young people do in the city for fun. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
